definitions.definition: To give a false representation of.
To contradict, to show (something) to be false.
definitions.example: Her obvious nervousness belied what she said.

definitions.definition: To conceal the contradictory or ironic presence of (something).
definitions.example: His calm demeanor belied his inner sense of guilt.

definitions.definition: To show, evince, demonstrate: to show (something) to be present, particularly something deemed contradictory or ironic.
